Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Combined pulmonary fibrosis and emphysema (CPFE) is a distinct clinical entity in which fibrotic lung disease (lower lobe), similar to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, coexists with emphysematous changes (upper lobe) in the same patient.
The most likely diagnosis is combined pulmonary fibrosis and emphysema (CPFE) (

A confident diagnosis can be made based on the presence of a usual interstitial pneumonia pattern on HRCT of the chest in the right clinical setting. In this patient, the presence of upper-lobe emphysema, in addition to lower-lobe fibrotic changes, confirms CPFE rather than IPF as the diagnosis.
